00036 // =============================================================================
00038 void PanStereo :: init()
00039 {
00040     // sources signal
00041     pValid_.push_back(aw::pNameOperand1);
00042     pTypeMap_[aw::pNameOperand1] = aw::gTypeMono;
00043 
00044     pValid_.push_back(aw::pNamePanLeftRight);
00045     pTypeMap_[aw::pNamePanLeftRight] = aw::gTypeMono;
00046 
00047 
00048     // setup some default generators 
00049     Generator::setParameter(aw::pNameOperand1, 0.0,
00050                     aw::pContextNameNone);
00051     Generator::setParameter(aw::pNamePanLeftRight, 0.5,
00052                     aw::pContextNameNone);
00053 
00054 
00055     // poly size is always 2 for stereo panner
00056     polySize_ = 2;
00057 }

00074 // =============================================================================
00075 // return a pointer to a working array
00076 double* PanStereo :: getPolyAtSample(aw::SampleTimeType st)
00077 {
00078 
00079     // need to deal with values outside of range; probably limit
00080     // at unit interval?
00081     panPos_ = pMap_[aw::pNamePanLeftRight]->getValueAtSample(st);
00082     amp_ = pMap_[aw::pNameOperand1]->getValueAtSample(st);
00083 
00084     // always operate on two values
00085     workingArray_[0] = amp_ * std::sqrt((1 - panPos_)); // left value
00086     workingArray_[1] = amp_ * std::sqrt(panPos_);
00087 
00088     return workingArray_;
00089 }
